text: Hi all, can't figure out how to use the value of the page selector in a repeater module in a <a href=".... Anyone any thoughts?

Gonna post this here for more visibility - please visit the link and upvote this idea! *One of my biggest problems is refactoring a module or adding / removing fields in the module -- then having to reload all of the content on the page level*. Currently you need to add another instance of the module, copy and paste your content, then remove the old iteration of the module on the page level. Let's see if we can get some upvotes behind this idea so we can have a "reset" button on the page level that brings the new module in and keeps the content in place. A HubSpot support person has setup the current idea for us to upvote. He will be meeting with the product team later this week. Let's get some steam behind this so we can streamline updating modules  <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Option-to-Reset-Module-at-Page-Level/idi-p/252089#M29361>
in the module, right sidebar there will be a copy value and a copy snippet. If you are on the group that has the repeater -- you will be able to copy the snippet and it will help you with that.

Potentially a workaround could be an advanced feature to set the module name at the template level, or otherwise "merge" the filed values of one module with a different one? This isn't an issue on coded templates as long as the module name (the unique identifier) doesn't change
Thnks

Does HubSpot minify CSS by default?
yes, it can fail though, but the conditions it fails under are rare for most people.
Getting an odd FOUC, think I could resolve through minifying, when i view source it looks like it currently isnt being minified

I remember there also being something about if you include CSS in the Head HTML of the page, HubSpot won't even try to minify. But maybe that was just for the CSS in custom modules. I can't remember exactly
<@UDFSF3N1F> That was regarding ```<style></style>``` tags.
<@U795QFHDE> look for any css syntax errors, look for `0s` `@supports` any colors which have a transparency of 0. Those can break minification.

When dealing with email building in HS is there any good way to force an image size if a user decides to add it into a rich text module? <https://templates.mailchimp.com/development/responsive-email/fluid-images/>

You have to edit the source of the rich text module.

Inline the max-width and width values.

The max-width should be the width of what the image should display at on full screen size

hi, we are working with the CRM extension API and we have a question: “iframe” is the only action type?
Hey Roberto, nope, there are action types as documented here <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/crm-extensions/crm-extensions-overview#action-types>
For example you could use type `ACTION_HOOK` to have HubSpot send out a webhook to your system
the thing is that whatsapp isnt working on iframes :s
Right, you do not need to use iframes with the CRM extensions API, it can simply send out an API call
yeah but we want a “card” on the CRM with the action of “contact via whatsapp” for sales people

The way that would is one of the actions you would define would be an `ACTION_HOOK` that sends out an API call to your system that would then translate that into how whatsapp is expecting.  The way to get content in there would be use the value of property.  If you want to add some input in there. That would need an iframe, that you could construct as a middle layer between HubSpot and whatsapp since as you noted we can’t iframe them directly
